III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Special evaluation
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12327
Section • (1) Upon receipt of any information that relates to possible
Description noncompliance with any foster home rule, the agency must
do all the following:
• (b) Initiate a special evaluation of the foster home as
soon as is indicated, based on the information
received, but not later than 7 calendar days after
receipt of the information.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency failed to initiate a special evaluation when informed of
allegations.
Investigation The agency Chief Administrator was notified of the complaint
via email and telephone on 07/17/24. The Chief Administrator
provided agency contact information.
The agency Licensing Supervisor was interviewed via
telephone on 08/19/24. The Licensing Supervisor provided the
following information. The agency received a complaint on an
agency foster home, (CG820403357), on 02/22/24. The agency
opened a special investigation on 02/23/24 on the home of Foster
Parent A. The agency had completed a recent previous
investigation on the home and had recommended revocation of
the license. The Licensing Supervisor had contacted the
Department of Child Welfare Licensing, Disciplinary Action Unit
(DCWL, DAU) on 02/22/24 asking if an investigation was required
on the current allegation given the agency had already
recommended revocation of the license. The Licensing Supervisor
reported that DAU staff informed her a special investigation on the
new allegations was required. The Licensing Supervisor reported
the agency opened a special investigation on 02/23/24 on the
home of Foster Parent A.
The Licensing Supervisor reported Foster Parent A was resistant
to allowing the agency to complete the investigation and would
frequently cancel visits with the agency licensing worker. The
Licensing Supervisor reported the investigation was completed in
2

May 2024, and she approved the report on 07/18/24 when she
returned from a leave of absence.
Staff 1, the agency licensing worker was interviewed via
telephone on 09/04/24. Staff 1 reported Foster Parent A was
resistant to cooperating with the investigation as she was
frustrated with the previous investigation which included the
recommendation of a revocation of the foster home license. Staff
1 reported Foster Parent A would cancel scheduled home visits
and not respond to phone calls. Staff 1 reported the investigation
was completed in May 2024 and submitted for approval. Staff 1
reported there was a delay in approval of his investigation as the
Licensing Supervisor was on leave and he was waiting for DHHS
to conclude their investigation.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
• The foster home file of Foster Parent A was reviewed
and the following was gathered:
• The agency initiated special evaluation 2024SEC0001369
on 02/23/24 after the complaint was received on 02/22/24.
• Social work contacts from 02/23/24 to 06/06/24 were
reviewed and indicated Foster Parent A missed nine
appointments for visits with Staff 1 and did not return his
phone calls.
• A 45 day extension letter dated 03/28/24 was reviewed.
• A 90 day extension letter dated 05/13/24 was reviewed.
• The Licensing Supervisor approved the report on 07/18/24.
• Email between the Licensing Supervisor and the DAU staff
person was reviewed and indicated Licensing Supervisor
contacted the DAU staff on 02/22/24 at which time the DAU
staff directed the agency to open a special evaluation.
Analysis The agency received a complaint on 02/22/24 and initiated a
special evaluation on 02/23/24 completing the investigation on
07/18/24.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
